Question_1.Context: The paper discusses the extension of non-Hermitian and Hermitian downfolding formulations to composite quantum systems commonly encountered in materials science and chemistry.
Question_1.Question: What is the main idea behind the non-Hermitian downfolding approach?
Question_1.A: Characterization of sub-systems in terms of active spaces
Question_1.B: Integration of external and internal cluster amplitudes
Question_1.C: Diagonalization of the effective Hamiltonian in the entire system
Question_1.D: Utilization of double unitary CC Ansatz
Question_1.Source: The main idea of SR-CC non-Hermitian downfolding hinges upon the characterization of sub-systems of a quantum system of interest in terms of active spaces or commutative sub-algebras of excitations that define corresponding active space.

Question_2.Context: The paper discusses the development of computational algorithms for composite quantum systems.
Question_2.Question: What is the example used to illustrate multi-component CC downfolding?
Question_2.Source: As an example, we used the model system composed of two types of Fermions, which epitomizes typical situations encountered in nuclear physics and for certain types of nuclei in non-Born-Oppenheimer electronic structure theory.

Question_3.Context: The paper discusses the extraction of the analytical form of interactions in many-body systems.
Question_3.Question: What is the purpose of fitting the general form of one-body and two-body interactions?
Question_3.A: To minimize discrepancies with the effective Hamiltonians
Question_3.D: To improve the accuracy of the results
Question_3.Source: These effective interactions replace standard one- and two-body interactions in non-relativistic quantum chemistry and are defined to minimize the discrepancies with {χP Q, χPQ RS} for a given discrete molecular spin-orbital set.

Question_4.Context: The paper discusses the utilization of machine learning techniques for the extraction of effective interactions.
Question_4.Question: What can the effective interactions derived from the minimization procedure be used for?
Question_4.B: To improve the accuracy of ab-initio dynamics
Question_4.D: To reduce the dimensionality of the system
Question_4.Source: The access to the analytical form of the inter-electron interactions can also enable affordable and reliable ab-initio dynamics driven by low-order methods.

Question_5.Context: The paper discusses the development of computational algorithms for composite quantum systems.
Question_5.Question: What is the main advantage of the downfolding framework for multi-component quantum systems?
Question_5.Source: The universal character of the discussed downfolding framework makes it applicable to a broad class of multi-component quantum systems encountered in nuclear theory, chemistry, and materials sciences.

Question_6.Context: The paper discusses the extension of non-Hermitian and Hermitian downfolding formulations to composite quantum systems.
Question_6.Question: What is the purpose of the double unitary CC Ansatz in the Hermitian downfolding approach?
Question_6.Source: Once TB and SAB amplitudes are know (or can be effectively approximated) the energy of the entire system can be calculated performing simulations on the sub-system A using effective Hamiltonian Heff(A).

Question_7.Context: The paper discusses the development of computational algorithms for composite quantum systems.
Question_7.Question: What is the advantage of the downfolding techniques for multi-component quantum systems?
Question_7.Source: The outlined downfolding techniques can also be useful in the context of reducing the numerical cost of expensive CC calculations for systems with periodic boundary conditions.

Question_8.Context: The paper discusses the extraction of the analytical form of interactions in many-body systems.
Question_8.Question: What is the approach used to derive the effective interactions in small-size active spaces?
Question_8.C: Fitting the general form of interactions
Question_8.Source: These effective interactions can be utilized in low-order methodologies, including Hartree-Fock (HF) and density functional theories (DFT). The access to the analytical form of the inter-electron interactions can also enable affordable and reliable ab-initio dynamics driven by low-order methods.

Question_9.Context: The paper discusses the utilization of machine learning techniques for the extraction of effective interactions.
Question_9.Question: What is the potential application of the effective interactions derived from the minimization procedure?
Question_9.B: Improving the accuracy of ab-initio dynamics
Question_9.D: Reducing the dimensionality of the system
Question_9.Source: The access to the analytical form of the inter-electron interactions can also enable affordable and reliable ab-initio dynamics driven by low-order methods.

Question_10.Context: The paper discusses the development of computational algorithms for composite quantum systems.
Question_10.Question: What is the main advantage of the downfolding framework for multi-component quantum systems?
Question_10.Source: The universal character of the discussed downfolding framework makes it applicable to a broad class of multi-component quantum systems encountered in nuclear theory, chemistry, and materials sciences.
